fields.description:
The value of the variable (whether global or specific to the build) is obfuscated when viewing the existing variable, but when the user attempts to change the value of that variable the value field isn't obfuscated on typing as it is when you define the variable.

Here's the lightbox before making edits:
!initial_value.png!

Here it is after inputting your own variable value:
!entered_value.png!
fields.summary: password variables should be obfuscated in "Run Customised"

fields.description:
Hi,

We are using ${bamboo.repository.revision.number} to embed within our application. We are also using mercurial. This generates a LONG number (which can be ugly for clients to see), for example:

8f0c90a4c158c0d66bec4cb390946c025891576a887c

It would be good, if we could restrict that to something like:

${bamboo.repository.revision.number|13}

8f0c90a4c158

I think this would come in useful!
fields.summary: allow formatting of bamboo.repository.revision.number

fields.description: Problem spotted by customer: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-7688
fields.summary: LazyInitializationException in ArtifactDefinitionContextImpl.init

fields.description:
# We should sent logs not only once per second, but also whenever the batch gets too big
# We should introduce a quota/throttling for logs, just like we have for artifacts.
fields.summary: Agent Log message handling improvements

fields.description: The delete all link on admin/elastic/allElasticInstances.action for all detached EBS volumes is quite dangerous, as a few errant clicks could remove a very large amount of valuable data.
fields.summary: 'Delete All' link for detached EBS volumes is dangerous

fields.description: I assume its from when we introduced template caching.  We either need to make them reloadable again, or, fix our docs so people dont think they are reloadable.
fields.summary: Notification Templates No longer Reloadable Without Restart

fields.description:
The 'Shut Down' link for the admin/elastic/allElasticInstances.action page seems to terminate an instance as opposed to stopping it. The difference being that terminating an instance will delete any attached EBS volume, whereas stopping an instance will keep the volume. More information can be found at:

* http://docs.amazonwebservices.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/Concepts_BootFromEBS.html#Instance_Termination

This is obviously a dangerous setting, as losing EBS volumes and thus valuable configurations is extremely undesirable.
fields.summary: Shut down link for EC2 instances terminates as opposed to stopping

fields.description: [~bmccoy]'s 20% project. We don't have any docs for this.
fields.summary: Document Author management feature
Re-run individually failed job
restoreEbsSnapshotFromUserData.sh does not work without /etc/profile.d/aws-apitools-common.sh

fields.description:
Currently Bamboo Maven auto dependency will always list the dependencies needed and produced by a plan, however linking (Parent-Child) will happen for SNAPSHOT builds only. 
When trying to define the linking Bamboo will search for the word "SNAPSHOT" in the pom.

In Bamboo, it should be possible to create the linking depending on the version range as well.
fields.summary: When using Maven auto dependencies, allow Bamboo to create plan linking depending on a version range

fields.description:
In linux, users can make scripts or task to run in the background by appending an ampersand (&) to the script. This will let other task to run smoothly. We have tested this behaviour with the Android emulator in Bamboo where we created a script with the following:

{noformat}
export ANDROID_HOME="/home/sultan/development/android-sdk-linux"
export PATH=${PATH}:${ANDROID_HOME}/platform-tools:${ANDROID_HOME}/tools
echo $PATH
emulator -avd my_android1.5 -no-window -noaudio &
echo $JAVA_HOME
{noformat}

The task runs smoothly with the emulator started successfully but the build keeps on running for ever unless we manually kill the emulator. This causes the build to block other tasks from running.
fields.summary: Launching Tasks in the Background from Bamboo fails

fields.description:
Due to permission issues, Bamboo is unable to sync agent during first run on custom images
{noformat}
Exception in thread "main" java.io.FileNotFoundException: /opt/bamboo-elastic-agent/lib/streams-core-plugin-5.2-m2.jar (No such file or directory)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.open(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:179)
	at java.io.FileOutputStream.<init>(FileOutputStream.java:131)
	at com.atlassian.aws.s3.S3Utils.fetch(S3Utils.java:282)
	at com.atlassian.aws.s3.S3Utils.doSync(S3Utils.java:266)
	at com.atlassian.aws.s3.S3Utils.sync(S3Utils.java:163)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.S3Sync.sync(S3Sync.java:72)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.agent.elastic.installer.ElasticAgentInstaller.main(ElasticAgentInstaller.java
{noformat}
fields.summary: Better handling of file permission issues for the bootstrap

fields.description:
Just because it would be useful. I erroneously made the mistake of thinking it was a built-in today instead of a user defined variable and that ended in awkwardness :/
I'd like to be able to add ${bamboo.planKey} and have it translated to the plan key in my build commands.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Using+global,+plan+or+build-specific+variables doesn't list it as a variable.
fields.summary: Please add the current plan key as a variable named planKey
Remove JGit support in favour of native Git

fields.description:
Our Continous Delivery Process defines to have a deployment to production environment at 2am in the morning.
Unfortunately, it is not possible to trigger a stage at a certain time.

Please provide a feature to define a time at when a stage will be executed.
fields.summary: Trigger stages at a certain time

fields.description:
It is possible to trigger release builds from Jira. Although thos builds are marked as release builds in Bamboo, there is no way to keep those builds (and ignore the build expiry).

Feature request:
There should be an option in the build expiry configuration to keep release builds.
fields.summary: Keep Jira-triggered Release Builds in Bamboo

fields.description:
1) We need to come up with a good list of web contexts (not too big, not too small)
2) We need to pull in these the contexts in the appropriate places
3) We need to document them so plugin devs can use them.
fields.summary: Design / Create / Document Bamboo Web Resource Contexts

fields.description:
If you have multiple jira applinks set up. and e.g. the default server is offline.  

Any calls to AppContainsProject will fail.  As the first failed server call will cause the whole filter to stop.  Rather than ignoring and checking the next server.

This gets used in multiple places. e.g. Creating Jira Issues, Remote Branch Linking and Our Redirect service for when you click to view an issue.
fields.summary: If first applink errors out, prevents other applinks from providing info.
Allow the user to use Artifact Passing via S3 without Bamboo Server

fields.description: Sometimes (not exactly sure under what circumstances), JIRA displays duplicate records of build executions. For example, on the Builds tab, I have got 2 build records both pointing to the same build execution in Bamboo, and one of the build records was saying "Code changed | Ran: N/A Duration: Unknown | Tests: No tests found"
fields.summary: JIRA displays duplicate build executions when build is re-run

fields.description:
Currently each remote agent is installed as a separate process on remote machine with its own home directory.
It consumes machine resources and it can execute only one job at the time.
It would be nice to have kind of remote installation of bamboo that can contain multiple remote agents in the same process.
This remote machine would be controlled from main/central bamboo server and from central server you would be able to create new remote agent when ever needed (similar to the creation of local agents).
This would be a quick way to scale and distribute build on the remote machine.
Also, it would be nice to have possibility to associate the whole plan to be executed on remote machine, not only specific job inside the plan.
fields.summary: Multiple remote agents in the same process

fields.description:
From: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-7201

We've recently fixed matching users with authors by email address (especially for git). However existing, non-associated author data was not associated after those changes. 

Some ideas for implementation:

- upgrade task that would attempt to associate non-associated author data with Bamboo users using all existing methods
- administrator available action that would do the above
- administrator available action that would do the above for a given user
fields.summary: Associate unassociated authors with Bamboo users

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to manage users using multiple authentication mechanisms. For example some users would authenticate against LDAP and others against the local user database.

As of version 4.0.1, we can only use either LDAP, local user database, or Crowd.

Are there plans to allow multiple authentication mechanisms like what's available in recent versions of JIRA, Confluence, and Fisheye?
fields.summary: Please allow multiple methods of user authentication (much like JIRA, Fisheye, and Confluence)

fields.description: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Configuring+agents
fields.summary: Add Elastic agent type to Configuring Agents docs.

fields.description: Some customers have requested that we support Remote Agents hosted on their own  hardware with Bamboo Cloud. Its possible to use only Elastic Agents on Bamboo Cloud at this time.
fields.summary: Support remote agents on Bamboo Cloud

fields.description:
Bamboo fails to start and the logs show this:
{code}
Caused by: com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneException: Failed to create searcher for directory: org.apache.lucene.store.FSDirectory@/export/software/atlassian/data/bamboo/index
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.createSearcher(LuceneConnection.java:487)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.<init>(LuceneConnection.java:93)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.<init>(LuceneConnection.java:98)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.LuceneConnection.<init>(LuceneConnection.java:113)
	at com.atlassian.bonnie.ConcurrentLuceneConnection.<init>(ConcurrentLuceneConnection.java:21)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.index.LuceneConnectionImpl.<init>(LuceneConnectionImpl.java:22)
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.java:57)

...

Caused by: java.io.IOException: read past EOF
	at org.apache.lucene.store.BufferedIndexInput.refill(BufferedIndexInput.java:146)
	at org.apache.lucene.store.BufferedIndexInput.readByte(BufferedIndexInput.java:38)
	at org.apache.lucene.store.IndexInput.readInt(IndexInput.java:66)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentInfos.read(SegmentInfos.java:207)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.DirectoryIndexReader$1.doBody(DirectoryIndexReader.java:68)
	at org.apache.lucene.index.SegmentInfos$FindSegmentsFile.run(SegmentInfos.java:636)
...
{code}

In order to fix the issue, one needs to delete the BAMBOO_HOME/index directory and start Bamboo server again. After, go to  Administration -> Indexing and do a full re-index when Bamboo is up and running again.

How can we predict and eliminate this failure?
fields.summary: Bamboo fails to start if Lucene index gets corrupted

fields.description: To prevent mismatch in features and characteristics, I would like Bamboo to identify any out-of-sync remote agent version numbers and report them to the administrator for correction.
fields.summary: Monitor Remote Agent version number and report out of sync versions

fields.description:
After changing a plan's configuration, I will typically want to run a new build to check that my changes have had the desired effect.

If the plan is already building (perhaps triggered by a repository commit), then either the "Run" button is disabled, or if it wasn't, then I am presented with an error saying something to the effect of "no more concurrent builds allowed".

This means I have to hang around until the build in progress finishes, and then remember to start another, to include my configuration changes.

It would be better if the "Run" button remained enabled, and queued the build if one was already running.
fields.summary: Allow builds to be queued manually

fields.description:
If I configure two artifacts from a plan, target/** as 'target' and dist/** as 'dist', where target contains multiple files, and dist contains only one, there's difference in what Bamboo returns as the URL to the artifact.

In the case of 'target', the URL is the path to the virtual directory. In the case of 'dist', the URL is directly to the file.

Noting that this is a nice shortcut, this doesn't seem to be documented anywhere, and I'm not sure I have a good solution, other than to argue that the same action doing two slightly different things seems awkward.

Possible ideas I kicked around included always having the artifact go to the virtual directory, adding an option as to whether the artifact was expected to be a single result, adding add'l information on the REST response indicating file v. directory, etc.

In the end, for what I needed, I'm now looking at the content-disposition header on the response from the artifact load and using that to make the determination, but it would be nice to know in advance.
fields.summary: Semantic difference in artifact link (both web and REST) if single v. multiple files in artifact tree

fields.description: See https://github.com/maestrodev/puppet-bamboo/
fields.summary: Install Bamboo using Puppet

fields.description:
We're using branch builds a lot, when we commit to an issue branch around 4 seperate builds are triggered against that issue branch(poor CBAC). I would like to be able to specify a branch name and see the results for those builds.

Currently I have to go into each plan that I know has been triggered and check the results before I merge back to master.
fields.summary: As a user of branch builds I'd like to see all builds run against given branch

fields.description:
Under 'Dependency Blocking Strategy', 
'Dependency blocking is a advanced feature' should be 'Dependency blocking is an advanced feature'
fields.summary: Typo on the Dependencies tab for plan configuration

fields.description:
Operation "git init" is implemented using jgit and it explicitely writes .git/config like this:
{noformat}
[core]
	repositoryformatversion = 0
	filemode = false
	logallrefupdates = true
	autocrlf = false
{noformat}
It causes clients on Windows checkout files with Unix line endings which might be disruptive (see https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-7156)
fields.summary: Git repository init doesn't respect global core.autocrlf setting

fields.description: if i have 2 jobs, A takes 30 minutes, B takes 15 minutes. if B fails due to flake, it sends me an IM immediately. I cant do anything about it for another 15 minutes (waiting for A). it would be nice to be able to restart it right now. the overall build would then take 30 minutes rather than 45 minutes. its a bit of a special case, i guess, but it would definitely be good in those special cases.
fields.summary: ability to re-run a job before the stage has completed

fields.description: Ability to detect pull requests, build it and merge pull request automatically with Bamboo.
fields.summary: Detect pull requests from Github and Bitbucket, merge changes, run tests and push

fields.description:
unless i am going crazy.

another possibility is that i got unwittingly redirected from the branch plan back to the default plan _before_ stopping the job.
fields.summary: stopping a job in a branch plan stopped the job in the default branch instead of the branch i was on

fields.description:
I have a Git repository configured in Bamboo 4.0.1, and I'm trying to use Branch Notifications. My Mail Server is correctly configured.
My Git {{master}} branch is listed under 'Branches' section of the Plan, and this is written in the Bamboo user interface under *Branch Notifications*:
bq. Notifications for your branch will be automatically generated. All committers and all people who have favourited this branch will receive notifications for build failures and first success after failure.

If the notifications will be sent automatically, no notification rules need to be configured in {{Plan Configuration > Notifications tab}}.

I have a Git Author defined this way:
{noformat}
git config --global user.name "Administrator"
git config --global user.email fkraemer@atlassian.com
{noformat}

This user exists in Bamboo, with these details:
* User Name: administrator
* Full Name: Administrator
* E-mail: fkraemer@atlassian.com
* Source Repository Alias: I tried to use three different aliases: {{administrator}}, {{Administrator}}, and {{Administrator <fkraemer@atlassian.com>}} 
This third one I retrieved by running this command in my Git repository: {{git log --raw | grep "^Author: " | sort | uniq -c}}

I committed code into {{master}} branch using this author and run a build, but I wasn't notified.
I also tried to add this plan as favorite to the {{administrator}} user, commit again and run a build again, but I wasn't notified as well.
fields.summary: Build plan branches do not send email notifications
I need the ability to create / clone a build plan for the SVVM project.

fields.description: Presently we have a [doco|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Configuring+remote+agent+capabilities+using+bamboo-capabilities.properties] that provides a general guide line that shows how we can configure remote agents capabilities. It will be nice if we can have a document the list out these possible values.
fields.summary: Provide a doco that provides a list of available properties that can be configured via the bamboo-capabilities.properties file
Pass the build-specific variables automatically into environment variables (like plan/global variables do)
Confluence deploy plugin task doesn't fail on 401 Unauthorized from server

I added 30 repositories in {{Plan Configuration >> Default Job >> Source Code Checkout task}}, by selecting a Repository in the dropdown, entering a "Checkout Directory", and clicking the "Add Repository" link after that in order to add the next one. All the 30 repositories were listed.

Then I clicked the "Save" button, and a message "Task saved successfully" appeared.

However, when I expanded the "Source Code Checkout" task again, only 23 repositories were listed.

fields.description:
Adding ANT_OPTS="-Xrs" to the Environment Variables field fixes the problem as it is mentioned here: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-3032. 

Please add a capability to enable this option for all Ant capabilities automatically, or hardcore into Bamboo source if it is feasible.
fields.summary: Ant builds get interrupted when logging out of Windows using Remote Desktop

fields.description:
Add support for automatically specifying the JVM's -Xrs flag for all ANT tasks. See http://docs.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/technotes/tools/windows/java.html for details on the -Xrs flag.

This issue is in response to a support request: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/BSP-7198

If Bamboo is hosted on Windows, and an administrator logs in to perform maintenance via Remote Desktop, any running ANT tasks are interrupted when he logs out. This is a problem with the JVM, where it misinterprets a logoff signal from Windows and erroneously terminates running Java processes (see http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6871190).

This problem can be avoided by specifying the -Xrs flag when the JVM is called. In Bamboo, adding ANT_OPTS="-Xrs" to the Environment Variables for an ANT task accomplishes this.

However this is problematic because users must remember to manually specify this every time they create new ANT tasks. Bamboo should support this flag automatically as some form of configuration parameter, so that it does not need to be entered per task.
fields.summary: Add support for enabling JVM -Xrs flag on all ANT tasks

fields.description: Now that authors can have an associated email, we should add field to the admin page.
fields.summary: Add email field to author administration

fields.description:
To reproduce:
* set the global build expiry to 1 week and save
* try and enter the global build expiry edit page
* the unit for global build expiry period is set to days

this can be extremely confusing (and somewhat catastrophic) if :
* expiry is 1 week
* someone edits the daily time, saves
* expiry gets reset to 1 day :(
fields.summary: When editing the global build expiry, the unit of time for the expiry period is always reset to "days"

fields.description:
According to [~jwinters], the plan was deleted. It seems to have survived and stuck around as a zombie. Hitting the build result produces:

{code}
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Trying to decorate a result for a plan that doesn't exist
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.beans.DecoratedResult.<init>(DecoratedResult.java:100)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.beans.DecoratedStageResult.<init>(DecoratedStageResult.java:54)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.beans.DecoratedResult.<init>(DecoratedResult.java:85)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.beans.DecoratedResult.decorateResult(DecoratedResult.java:68)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.interceptors.NavigationAwareInterceptor.getNavObject(NavigationAwareInterceptor.java:106)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.interceptors.NavigationAwareInterceptor.doIntercept(NavigationAwareInterceptor.java:63)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.interceptors.AbstractBambooInterceptor$1.call(AbstractBambooInterceptor.java:36)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.interceptors.AbstractBambooInterceptor$1.call(AbstractBambooInterceptor.java:32)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.util.BambooProfilingUtils.withUtilTimerStack(BambooProfilingUtils.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.interceptors.AbstractBambooInterceptor.intercept(AbstractBambooInterceptor.java:31)
	at com.opensymphony.xwork.DefaultActionInvocation.invoke(DefaultActionInvocation.java:190)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.interceptors.BuildResultsSummaryAwareInteceptor.doIntercept(BuildResultsSummaryAwareInteceptor.java:61)
	at com.atlassian.bamboo.ww2.interceptors.AbstractBambooInterceptor$1.call(AbstractBambooInterceptor.java:36)

fields.summary: Trying to browse to /browse/JIRA51-RELEASE-1 on JBAC produces "Trying to decorate a result for a plan that doesn't exist"

fields.description:
In this text:

"You can configure this Branch to trigger child Branches. A Branch is a child Branch of this Branch iff it has the same name as this branch and the Master Plan of the Branch is a Child of this Branch'es Master Plan."

'Branch'es' should be 'Branch's'.

Further, capitalisation of 'Branch' is inconsistent in that text. 
So is that for 'Child'. 

Overall, capitalisation in the interface is getting out of hand. Very Victorian!

Also, 'iff' is crpytic... it could be expanded to 'if and only if', if it is actually even necessary.
fields.summary: Spelling on the Branch Dependencies page
Prevent two agents from running in the same home directory (or the same build directory)

fields.description: Any branch which has a - in the name will not show as a branch in the UI.
fields.summary: Current Activity Page doesn't always show branches as branches

fields.description: Job Committers dont really get used for anything.  I believe it would be much  more intuitive if the plans committers get used for the committer recipient type regardless of whether the notification is a Plan notification or a Job notification.
fields.summary: Job Notifications should use Plan's Committers

fields.description:
Bamboo already has deployment tasks for [Tomcat|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2011/05/continuous_deployment_with_bamboo_and_tomcat/] and [JBoss|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.jboss.bamboo-jboss-plugin]. We should support deploying to Websphere containers using tasks.

See [Websphere Deployment API|http://pic.dhe.ibm.com/infocenter/wasinfo/v6r0/topic/com.ibm.websphere.javadoc.doc/public_html/api/com/ibm/websphere/management/package-summary.html]
fields.summary: Deployment tasks for WebSphere

fields.description:
Bamboo already has deployment tasks for [Tomcat|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2011/05/continuous_deployment_with_bamboo_and_tomcat/] and [JBoss|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.bamboo.plugins.jboss.bamboo-jboss-plugin]. We should support deploying to Weblogic containers using tasks.

See [Weblogic Deployment API|http://docs.oracle.com/cd/E15051_01/wls/docs103/deployment_api/api_intro.html]
fields.summary: Deployment tasks for Weblogic

fields.description: The selection box for choosing one remote branch from a list sorts all remote branches alphabetically and only shows about 20 branches at a time (you have to keep clicking 'more'). It would be nice if you could see all of them (no 'more' button) or if they were sorted by modified date or could be filtered somehow with a search box.
fields.summary: Add ability to sort / filter the manual branch creation selection

fields.description:
Currently, you have to go to configure plan -> branches and click a small button "create branch" to manually branch a plan.

This should be easier (more visible).  How about a button next to "+ Create Plan" on the toolbar?
fields.summary: Add an Easier Way to Manually Branch a Plan

fields.description:
Currently the "default" branch treated differently from all of the other branches.

# It would be nice to be able to rename the default branch to "master" or "trunk" anything else.
# It would be nice if the dashboard (all plans) page showed information about other branches (not just default).
# It would be nice if the "branches" page of a plan showed all branches (including default)

All the branches should be equivalent. In fact, you should be able to delete the "default" (first) branch and still have a plan.
fields.summary: Treat the "Default" branch similarly to other branches
Add option to remove remote branches that have been deleted

fields.description: Provide flexibility to be able to (manually) branch a plan, change the branch of the non-default repository, or change both the default and another repo at the same time.
fields.summary: Provide flexibility in choosing a repository while branching a plan

fields.description: Provide filter on Dashboard -> Current Activity page  be able to filter let's say by agent(s) or project(s).
fields.summary: Provide filtering feature on Dashboard -> Current Activity page

fields.description: Currently Bamboo shows the last completed build number and a spinning sign. This can be confusing as clicking on the spinning circle takes to the currently running build. Maybe it is a good idea to split the Build tab into 3 tabs showing last successful, last failed and the currently running builds?
fields.summary: Separate Build tab on the All Plans page of Dashboard

fields.description: It would allow HipChat users to (e.g.) receive committer notifications.
fields.summary: It should be possible to associate a user with HipChat room/account
The jiraIssues tag returned from the REST CALL to retrieve the build results for a specific plan in a project always have a zero size when the URL is narrowed down to job level
Build variable "buildForceCleanCheckout" stopped working

fields.description:
If you've got a text of format in the commit comment 'xxx-xxx' Bamboo will assume this to be a JIRA issue key

We should check if the project key is valid before generating the hyperlink
fields.summary: Bamboo shouldn't generate JIRA issue links if the project doesn't exist in JIRA

fields.description: Would like to be able to re order how the projects and/or plans appear on the main page
fields.summary: Would like to customize the order of projects/plans on the screen

fields.description: Would like to group projects by color or assign different colors to each plan
fields.summary: Would like to be able to color code the main dashboard

fields.description:
This feature seems handy (to hide the original address and ask recipients to reply to a generic email address), but it will open a gap for email spoofing. 

As an alternative, you can try to [edit the notification templates|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMBOO/Freemarker+and+notification+templates] to mention the special REPLY_TO address, but your FROM address will still be seen. Another alternative can be using an intermediary email, which will process the initial email and forward it further.
fields.summary: Add a feature to configure a REPLY_TO email address different from FROM address for Bamboo Mail server

fields.description:
Hi Team,

We encounter an issue in a plan where Bamboo connects to UNIX machine through remote agent and do checkout for the repository configured in Repository URL. Attached the log file of the error. 

The UNIX machine is very new and we've configured remote agent for it successfully.We're ruuning in to this issuw while triger the plan. I tried to check svn co command works on UNIX machine by executing the command directly on the machine. It's working fine. 

Below are the configuation details of both Bamboo and UNIX machine

UNIX machine
========================================
Operating System : Linux Red Hat 4.1.2-50

SVN version : 

$ svn --version
svn, version 1.6.11 (r934486)
   compiled May 31 2011, 06:01:42

Copyright (C) 2000-2009 CollabNet.
Subversion is open source software, see http://subversion.tigris.org/
This product includes software developed by CollabNet (http://www.Collab.Net/).

The following repository access (RA) modules are available:

* ra_neon : Module for accessing a repository via WebDAV protocol using Neon.
  - handles 'http' scheme
  - handles 'https' scheme
* ra_svn : Module for accessing a repository using the svn network protocol.
  - with Cyrus SASL authentication
  - handles 'svn' scheme
* ra_local : Module for accessing a repository on local disk.
  - handles 'file' scheme

JAVA Version :

$ java -version
java version "1.6.0_30"
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_30-b12)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 20.5-b03, mixed mode)

Bamboo machine : 

Operating System : Virtual Machine Win2008 64bit
Bamboo version 3.4.3 build 2811
SVN Version : 1.7(64 bit)

Please let me know if you need any more information.

Thanks,
Logumani
fields.summary: Bamboo plan is failing with "Failed to checkout source code"

fields.description:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=179447039

The 6.1.15 jar we tell people to download does not have the class org.eclipse.jetty.ajp.Ajp13SocketConnector so the xml snippet wont work. 

We either need to provide two snippets, or assume the latest version of Bamboo will use at least 6.1.26 and remove the jar (but make sure it still exists on older pages which i dont it is)
fields.summary: AJP docs require different xml snippet depending on AJP version

fields.description:
The Rerun failed jobs button is never where i expect it to be. On a failed job, i click on that job, see what when wrong, see that it is an infrastructure failure, now i want to rerun it... how? I have to go back to the build summary page, _then_ go to the drop down that was visible on the job result page, but didnt have the rerun option:

best described in pictures:
!https://img.skitch.com/20120628-ibncegdmmx4284hxj11bbb3ji.jpg!

!https://img.skitch.com/20120628-bj349t2kiu4ex1usknjxq98y41.jpg!

!https://img.skitch.com/20120628-j8j4xxajiukmbyi628cfdgft14.jpg!

please save my time and if youre going to put it in a top-level drop down, it should always be there.
fields.summary: Rerun failed jobs button plays hide and seek

fields.description: Add A Web Panel Across the Top of All Pages in Bamboo allowing toolw-ide messages to be inserted. Right now if you "Pause" the server a banner displays across the top. It would be great if that real estate was addressable by plugins as well via web-panels.
fields.summary: Add A Web Panel Across the Top of All Pages in Bamboo

fields.description: In Stash you can add ?web.items or ?web.panels to any page's URL and after a page reload it highlights red borders around all the areas on the page that are extension points. This would be really cool to have in Bamboo too, especially for new plugin developers.
fields.summary: Add Web Item and Panel Highlighting via URL Parameters Like Stash
Add trigger condition to block a plan from building if another plan is being executed

fields.description: Since the changes we made to save results before a build, it really doesn't matter if a 'dead' agent suddenly comes back alive and wants to update the result.   We should be more forgiving.
fields.summary: No longer discard results that come back after agent is offline

fields.description:
Minor story in the  4.2 release.
Branch name now gets name from the repo (no longer just called 'default') e.g. in git, default branch is called master.
fields.summary: Update documentation for the naming of plan branches from the repository

fields.description:
Build strategy for branches

*    was previously only on commit
*    now is same as for plans
*    new branches need to have strategy set specifically - have just the 'on commit' option
fields.summary: Provide documentation for using build strategies with plan branches

fields.description:
Story for 4.2 release.
Notifications now also can use plans not settings, or not at all.
Can set default for newly created branches (can change later for a specific branch).

e.g hipchat
fields.summary: Provide documentation about notifications for plan branches

fields.description:
Story for the 4.2 release.
On a build result, for branch, is a summary of issue, right under breadcrumb
fields.summary: Update the documentation for JIRA integration in Bamboo 4.2

fields.description: Story for the 4.2 release.
fields.summary: Provide documentation for dependencies in plan branches

fields.description:
Story in 4.2 release.

Bamboo guesses the URL for the branch, based on convention, but can edit.
fields.summary: Provide documentation for SVN branches

fields.description: Is this necessary?
fields.summary: Provide documentation for bitbucket integration
Provide documentation for the MyBamboo page

fields.description: Documentation is scattered over several pages...
fields.summary: Improve the documentation for integration with Clover
Provide documentation for projects
Provide documentation for configuring app links and entity links

fields.description:
Plan branches are great for allowing us to maintain a single set of configuration. However, it is hard to have visibility of a single branch across multiple plans.

It's not possible at the moment to tell which plans are building a specific branch. Perhaps a branch-centric view, or some kind of pipelined view of a branch?
fields.summary: Provide visibility for plan branches across plans

fields.description:
Try this: 

1. Add a repo to Stash, and use a repo name that contains white space --I used "Angry Nerds Website". 

2. Add that same repository to Bamboo as either a globally shared repo or a Plan-specific repo.  In the "Advanced Settings" section, link that repo to Stash.  

3. From a build result page in Bamboo, click on a change set from the repo.  You'll be sent to Stash to log in. 

4. Look on in dismay as Stash presents you with a 404 page claiming that there is no repo with the name "Angry Nerds Website".

5. Click the "View repositories" link on the 404 page.  

6. Call bullshit on Stash when the repositories page clearly displays a repo with the name "Angry Nerds Website".  

Seems to be the whitespaces in the name that screws things up.  The linking behavior works fine if you name the repo "AngryNerdsWebsite".
fields.summary: Linking repositories b/tw Stash and Bamboo fails if the repo name contains spaces

fields.description:
A build fails due to a compilation problems, but because a few tests are quarantined, the Task that builds and tests is made successful by Bamboo.

The problem is that other builds use the code that should have been built by the Task and in this case, even if tests were quarentined, the Task should have failed because of the compilation failed.

Quarantining should only change the state of the build if the state is based on test failures.

Separating the logic into two tasks might be a good workaround. (Where the first 'build' task is marked as not producing test results).
fields.summary: Build failure made successful by Bamboo due to quarantined tests

fields.description:
Here is the waring that I get when I run a remote agent with configured context path:

{code}
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2012/06/25 11:16:36 | 2012-06-25 11:16:35,923 WARN [ActiveMQ Task] [TcpTransportFactory] path isn't a valid local location for TcpTransport to use
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2012/06/25 11:16:36 | java.lang.NumberFormatException: For input string: "/bamboo2"
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2012/06/25 11:16:36 | 	at java.lang.NumberFormatException.forInputString(NumberFormatException.java:48)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2012/06/25 11:16:36 | 	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:449)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2012/06/25 11:16:36 | 	at java.lang.Integer.parseInt(Integer.java:499)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2012/06/25 11:16:36 | 	at org.apache.activemq.transport.tcp.TcpTransportFactory.createTransport(TcpTransportFactory.java:128)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2012/06/25 11:16:36 | 	at org.apache.activemq.transport.TransportFactory.doCompositeConnect(TransportFactory.java:156)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2012/06/25 11:16:36 | 	at org.apache.activemq.transport.TransportFactory.compositeConnect(TransportFactory.java:93)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2012/06/25 11:16:36 | 	at org.apache.activemq.transport.failover.FailoverTransport.doReconnect(FailoverTransport.java:842)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2012/06/25 11:16:36 | 	at org.apache.activemq.transport.failover.FailoverTransport$2.iterate(FailoverTransport.java:135)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2012/06/25 11:16:36 | 	at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner.runTask(PooledTaskRunner.java:122)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2012/06/25 11:16:36 | 	at org.apache.activemq.thread.PooledTaskRunner$1.run(PooledTaskRunner.java:43)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2012/06/25 11:16:36 | 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.runTask(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:886)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2012/06/25 11:16:36 | 	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:908)
INFO   | jvm 1    | 2012/06/25 11:16:36 | 	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:680)
{code}


Here is the Broker URI configuration part:
{code}
...
<property name="bamboo.jms.broker.client.uri">failover:(tcp://127.0.0.1:54663/bamboo1?wireFormat.maxInactivityDuration=300000)?maxReconnectAttempts=10&initialReconnectDelay=15000</property>
<property name="bamboo.jms.broker.uri">tcp://0.0.0.0:54663?wireFormat.maxInactivityDuration=300000</property>
...
{code}

I will make a note about this waring in [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BAMKB/Running+2+Bamboo+instances+on+the+same+machine].

Even though Bamboo gives this warning, the remote agents load and get registered properly.
fields.summary: Getting a warning when trying to run a remote agent with configured context path

fields.description:
Here are the steps to reproduce the problem:

* Create a job to build an Xcode project. Select "build an .ipa for iOS distribution"
* Enter pretty much anything in "Certificate Identity Name"
* Build will always be signed with the default "iPhone Developer" identity

No possibility of signing apps with different (for example, "iPhone Distribution") certificate; the CI machine doesn't even have a Developer identity, and the following error is thrown:

=== BUILD NATIVE TARGET [redacted] OF PROJECT [redacted] WITH CONFIGURATION Release ===
22-Jun-2012 11:21:44	Check dependencies
22-Jun-2012 11:21:44	Code Sign error: The identity 'iPhone Developer' doesn't match any valid, non-expired certificate/private key pair in the default keychain
fields.summary: Xcode Module for Bamboo should allow more flexible signing

fields.description: A customer has an external_entities table that has ~48201 rows in it and it takes approximately 90 minutes to export.
fields.summary: Exporting the external_entities table is slow

fields.description: I am using GIT.  Bamboo tells me merging is disabled because my repository does not support it. However, its got nothing to do with the repository type. The problem is the lack of a git capability (native git).
fields.summary: Merging disabled message for git not helpful

fields.description:
Builds on BEAC are not being queued. On the "all plans" page, the icon is the blue queued icon. However on the "current activity" page, there is nothing under queued, and nothing under building. After a few minutes the builds are aborted and go yellow.

Looking in the system errors I see:
"Build RELENG-RELENGDUMMY1-JOB1-57 had to be cancelled: it was marked as queued but was not present in the queue for (at least) the past 210 seconds."

Popping up for each build.

This is only happening on BEAC, the other bamboo servers are fine.
fields.summary: Queued builds not showing in the build queue, not being picked up by agents

java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.NullPointerException

My only workaround is to change the repo to a normal HG one (not BB)
fields.summary: NPE in HG Bitbucket repos

fields.description:
It's quite easy to reproduce on my test instances.
# Create a build plan. Build type and other details don't seem to matter.
# Check the "enable this build plan" box before clicking the "Create" button.
# The build plan is dispatched to execute. If we click the link to the running build plan, we will get a screen like the one attached, with the navigation banner saying something like "Build: #1 is building - null".

I will try to make a video for this next time I saw it.
fields.summary: Sometimes Bamboo says "#n is build - null"
PlanFavouriteRemovedEvent and PlanFavouriteAddedEvent Seems to Reverse Functionality

fields.description:
I downloaded Bamboo 2.7.4 source code from https://my.atlassian.com/, and I'm trying to build it for the first time. 
After extracting the zip, I executed {{build.bat}}, which started downloading a lot of stuff as expected, but later on the build failed with the following message:
{noformat}
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[ERROR] BUILD ERROR
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Failed to resolve artifact.

Missing:
----------
1) com.atlassian.bamboo:atlassian-bamboo-agent-elastic-image-default:ami:2.7.4

  Try downloading the file manually from the project website.

  Then, install it using the command:
      mvn install:install-file -DgroupId=com.atlassian.bamboo -DartifactId=atlassian-bamboo-agent-elastic-image-default -Dversion=2.7.4 -Dpackaging=ami -Dfile=/path/to/file

  Alternatively, if you host your own repository you can deploy the file there:
      mvn deploy:deploy-file -DgroupId=com.atlassian.bamboo -DartifactId=atlassian-bamboo-agent-elastic-image-default -Dversion=2.7.4 -Dpackaging=ami-Dfile=/path/to/file -Durl=[url] -DrepositoryId=[id]

  Path to dependency:
        1) com.atlassian.bamboo:atlassian-bamboo-agent-elastic-server:jar:2.7.4
        2) com.atlassian.bamboo:atlassian-bamboo-agent-elastic-image-default:ami:2.7.4

----------
1 required artifact is missing.

for artifact:
  com.atlassian.bamboo:atlassian-bamboo-agent-elastic-server:jar:2.7.4

from the specified remote repositories:
  central (https://m2proxy.atlassian.com/repository/internal),
  atlassian-m1-repository (https://maven.atlassian.com/repository/m1/),
  atlassian-proxy (https://m2proxy.atlassian.com/repository/public)



[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] For more information, run Maven with the -e switch
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
[INFO] Total time: 5 minutes 7 seconds
[INFO] Finished at: Fri Jun 22 17:59:35 BRT 2012
[INFO] Final Memory: 108M/247M
[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------
{noformat}
fields.summary: Missing Maven dependencies building Bamboo's source code

fields.description:
I itegrated Bamboo with Jira and I am currently using Jiras userrepository for authentification with Bamboo.
At the moment I can only grant permissions to Bamboo plans based on users and groups (both managed in Jira). I would like to grant permissions for Bamboo Plans based on Jira Project roles. This would simplify user managment as all permissions could be controled by Jira project admins simply by adding and removing users from the roles in there projects.
fields.summary: Bamboo should not allow permissions based on Jira project roles not only groups and users
